talks.title: Modern Python packaging
talks.speaker: Aarni Koskela
talks.description: Still using setup.py and requirements.txt for your library or application? You probably shouldn't be! A small tour and opinionated talk on newer (and arguably better) alternatives.

talks.title: Debugging Python
talks.speaker: Juha-Matti Santala
talks.description: Debugging can be a stressful experience to a developer. In this talk, I provide practical and hands-on tips both for dealing both with the mental side and the technical tools and approaches that can help Python developers turn stressful debugging situations into joyful experiences.

special.name: Testing Sprint
special.description: Our first sprint in February was focused around polishing our skills in writing tests.

talks.title: Good-enough SRE for production software projects
talks.speaker: Magdalena Stenius
talks.description: During the past couple of years, SRE seems to have become the new hype-word of engineering. In this talk I’ll walk you through some of the basic themes of it and a practical example of good-enough SRE practices for Wolts personalisation-api service, the central service for multiple models catering to our global user base every day.

talks.title: Implementing and using Rule-based systems in Python
talks.speaker: Mikko Harju
talks.description: In this talk, we will explore what rule-based systems are, how to use the py-rete as the foundation to create your own rule-based systems and extend the syntax a bit to aid simpler definition of specific rules.

special.name: Web Dev Sprint
special.description: Our second sprint focused on web development tools like Django, Flask and FastAPI.

talks.title: Vector Embeddings: Clustering, Recommendations, and Visualization in Python
talks.speaker: Robert Siipola

talks.title: Building web-APIs with Python
talks.speaker: Calle Laakkonen
talks.description: A quick introduction to building REST and GraphQL APIs using different frameworks to suit all occasions, from simple minimalistic utilities to big web applications.

talks.title: Deep dive into Python generators
talks.speaker: Janne Rönkkö
talks.description: Generators can be found pretty much every Python project -- you might be using those without realizing it. In this talk we will explore what Python's generators are, how they work, their pitfalls and how you can utilize those in your own projects.

talks.title: Let’s be BFFs <3
talks.speaker: Mila Grigoryeva
talks.description: Let’s look into a web development design pattern called BFF - Backend for Frontend. In this talk, I will walk you through the main concepts as well as share both pros and cons of using such a design pattern in your web system.

special.name: Advent of Code Sprint
special.description: In December we got together to solve Advent of Code puzzles together at Konttori.
